author: James Francalangia
comment: The photos show that the screen is full with the camera image but in fact there are either black bars on the top or side depending on your orientation.  This should be an option, don't care if I'm missing some of the image   wtf?  emailed dev, no response.  what would also be nice is a button to force on the light.  No response.  Don't waste your money.  Try something else like PixtoCam, that does video and you can force the light on in that mode.

author: Ian Troy Alvaran
comment: I used to have an LG G4 and paired it with the LG Watch Urbane. Since the application had a native app, I didn't need a third party remote shutter.  However, when I had to switch phones and switched to the Samsung Galaxy Note FE, the remote shutter thing on my watch is my most missed feature on my old phone. Note that I still have the Urbane as my daily driver as it ain't broke yet.  I was hesitant to buy this at first due to the lack of (legitimate) reviews, and after trying it out, it's definitely works. The black bars shouldn't really bother you., and it's better this way as that's the same way how the native remote shutter app works when I had an LG phone.  Things I liked: 1.) Ability to stream the shot from your phone to your watch, much like the old native remote shutter app. 2.) More fine controls like setting up the timer and flash from the watch 3.) Can still take pictures even with the flip cover closed 4.) Silent shots Things to improve: 1.) Ability to store pictures on SD card 2.) Ability to take videos. 3.) I literally can't find the "doze' mode.   Things that I would want to work but is very unlikely: 1:) Make it compatible with the native camera app.

author: Johnny Villanueva
comment: Thanks for the app. Love it.

author: Brian Lemieux
comment: Worked fine on my LG G Watch R and Note 4, not so much with my Nexus 6P. Just tells me another program is using the camera.
title: Android 6 issues

author: Doctor Z
comment: I purchased because it specifically says you can turn off the shutter sound. I have a Huawei watch and the feature does not work. If this bug cannot be fixed let me know and I will request a refund.
title: Sound mute does not work

author: Edgar Aguiar
comment: The app is good the only problem don't work with the camera on

author: Michael Tracy
comment: Thanks first of all for making this app! I really love having all those options directly on my watch! I am running Android 4.4.2. On my phone and the newest 5.0.1 on my watch. I came across some bugs though: 1. when I choose to mute the shutter sound, it still makes the sound.  2. Once I take a picture I have to close the app on the watch right away, otherwise it keeps taking one picture after another every 2 seconds.  If you could resolve those issues I would be ever so grateful ^~^ love your work so far!
title: Love the idea =) Some issues though

author: B Wild
comment: Tried another generic wear app and was a bit buggy. Great to see one written for LG watches. Works well. One suggestion would be to have the whole screen used {without black strips top and bottom } for picture. My watch is LG urbane.
title: Good job

author: Joshua Jackson
comment: Great attempt dev but I paid for this and was in a position so I couldn't do the refund in time, but problems... It has tons. The picture on my g watch r is either upside down or side ways for the camera and it Definitely doesn't pull up like the picture shows. There's a free app for the g watch r and actually works. If things get fixed, I'll gladly re-rate.
title: NEEDS SERIOUS WORK

author: Charles Hogard Jr
comment: It's not working. It took two horrible pictures that I never saw a preview for. What's the issue? I've tried everything, uninstalling unfortunately.
title: Urbane and HTC M9

author: Robert Mador
comment: Seems to work well with my LG G Watch R and Galaxy S5! I just snapped a few photos with it, wasn't a real test of its capabilities.   One thing I would suggest for the developer is to allow the photos to be stored on an external memory card. Right now there are only Internal choices. I just noticed that the photos showed up on my G Watch R right side up... but were saved rotated to the left 90 degrees on my phone! What's up with that? Fix the rotation problem and allow photos to be stored on external memory and I'll change my rating to 5 stars. Especially for an app that has to be paid for!

author: Raymond Garcia
comment: Add a video recording option. And fix the delay between picture taking, it should be able to take continuous pictures. Snap after snap!
title: Needs the recommended updates

author: Jos van Baal
comment: Also have some tasker tasks for photos but this app gives some nice extras. Only downside is that the name of the app is different in the app list. Accidentally refunded it while removing my other camera app.
title: Very handy

author: Hilman Chung
comment: Updated:  Now no longer need to close app from phone.  Old review:  Great effort but one huge flaw is the requirement to close the app from the phone.

reply.author: watea network
reply.content:
Thank you for your feedback.
I've updated the app for this problem.would you please check the latest version.
Thank you.

title: Great!

comment: Picture is shown as a small rectangle on the watch screen not full face as the advertisement pictures have you believe. Deceiving.  Also crashes every time i take a pic, so rather useless.
title: Not Good

author: Joshua M
comment: Works fine with G watch R and S4 but now it constantly crashes with my new S6. Needs some work
title: Stopped working with S6

author: Abdallah Alessa
comment: Everything works good but the shutter mute is not working for some reason.
title: Great Features, Works fine but..

author: Sam S
comment: love the app,love the idea work fine
title: nice

author: Rell Barbee
comment: This app is awesome.
title: Awesome

author: Quentin Reid
comment: Very good l enjoy it

author: Orbon Higgs
comment: Great app!

author: David A. Bynoe
comment: Works on moto 360.
title: Moto 360

author: Joel Winters
comment: Worked the first time and fourth time but has not again since. Have restarted both the phone and the watch with no change. Would love if this app works, would be a must have for andriod wear.
title: Great concept,  but kept crashing or failing to open.

author: Damion Wallace
comment: Good app, works great, little lag.     Taking picture is a bit too long, picture isn't full screen square instead,  but apart from that decent app.
title: Note Edge with Huawei Watch
